body:
Comment 3: 
I think we need to do more than that. 'godoc godoc' has to work in a stock Go
distribution, which will not include any subrepo source code. The tool that builds
binary distributions should probably copy the package doc from godoc, cover, and vet
(any others?) into otherwise-empty subdirectories of $GOROOT/cmd.

godoc can use those files as a fallback if a $GOPATH version (presumably it would be
newer) cannot be found.
